Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2010 08:49PM lindainfla wrote: Thank you ladies. There is no better place to allay your fears and bolster your spirits.  I sure hope there is someone out there for me...I put it out to the universe, just like I have with all of the stress and fear and uncertainty of breast cancer.
Posts.Title: dating lindainfla lindainfla

Posts.Content: lindainfla wrote: My husband did not make it through breast cancer as well as I did and took a pass on our 25 year long marriage.  I have chosen not to have reconstruction after a double mastectomy...and am now wondering about the possibility of dating?  Have any of you wonderful ladies had experience with new relationships when one, or both of you, is missing a some integral parts?  I'd love to hear from you. Dx 10/2008, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IIB, 2/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: dating lindainfla lindainfla

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2009 12:28AM lindainfla wrote: Hi!  I agree with Tami that the odds are in your favor.  But ask about lobular carcinoma.  It's a thickening, rather than a lump.  It's much harder to detect.  I was told "you have dense breast tissue" for years.  Women are trained to feel for lumps...not ridges or thickening.  All the best to you! Linda
Posts.Title: Trying not to be scared! BlazerFan leaf
